episodeTitle: A Special Presentation Related to the Movie! A Gold Lion's Ambition on the Move!
episodeTitleJapanese: 映画連動特別編 動き出す金獅子の野望
episodeTitleRomanized: Eiga Rendō Supesharu - Ugokidasu Kinjishi no Yabō
description: The Straw Hats encounter a giant beetle named Boss and are taken to Little East Blue, an island recreating their East Blue origins. Meanwhile, a flashback reveals Shiki the Golden Lion's daring escape from Impel Down twenty years earlier, setting the stage for the movie-connected arc.

events.title: Shiki's Daring Escape from Impel Down
events.description: Twenty years ago, Shiki the Golden Lion becomes the first prisoner to escape from Impel Down. To free himself from his shackles, he cuts off his own legs and uses his Fuwa Fuwa no Mi powers to levitate away, leaving Magellan and the guards shocked.
events.significance: Establishes Shiki as a legendary pirate who accomplished what was thought impossible - escaping from the world's most secure prison. This event hurt the prison's pride and Magellan's reputation as vice warden.

events.title: Boss the Giant Beetle Appears
events.description: While the Straw Hats are fishing, a massive horned beetle named Boss appears and eats the large fish that Brook caught. The beetle then attacks the Thousand Sunny.
events.significance: Introduces Boss, a key character in the Little East Blue arc who serves as Yoko's companion and the target of the Amigo Pirates.

events.title: Yoko Commands Boss to Attack
events.description: Yoko, seeing the pirate ship, commands Boss to kill the Straw Hat Pirates. Her hatred for pirates stems from her father's death at the hands of pirates while he was protecting their village as a Marine.
events.significance: Introduces Yoko and establishes her anti-pirate sentiment, which becomes a key conflict point in the arc.

events.title: Luffy vs Boss
events.description: Luffy battles Boss at the top of the Thousand Sunny's sail. Despite Franky's unsuccessful attack, Luffy takes a liking to the giant beetle and tries to recruit it to his crew.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's typical personality of wanting unusual creatures on his crew and establishes his playful relationship with Boss.

events.title: Arrival at Little East Blue
events.description: Boss takes Luffy, Zoro, Usopp, and Sanji to a nearby island. The island is revealed to be Kansorn Island, also known as Little East Blue - a town modeled after the East Blue.
events.significance: Introduces the main setting for the Little East Blue arc, a nostalgic recreation of the Straw Hats' origins.

events.title: Discovery of East Blue Replicas
events.description: The Straw Hats discover that Little East Blue contains replicas of their home locations: a giant windmill reminding Luffy of Foosha Village, a training hall for people from Zoro's hometown Shimotsuki Village, Baratie where Sanji was raised, and a mansion that reminds Usopp of Kaya's home.
events.significance: Creates a nostalgic connection for the crew members and establishes the unique nature of this island community.

events.title: Amigo Pirates Approach
events.description: Corto and his brother Largo, leaders of the Amigo Pirates, along with their men, head to Kansorn Island to capture Boss because it escaped from Shiki.
events.significance: Introduces the main antagonists of the arc and establishes the conflict over Boss.

events.title: Luffy vs Largo
events.description: Luffy engages in a one-on-one battle with Largo, one of the Amigo Pirates' leaders who came to capture Boss.
events.significance: Begins the main conflict of the episode between the Straw Hats and the Amigo Pirates.

events.title: Luffy Defeats Largo with Gear Third
events.description: Luffy uses his Gear Third technique to defeat Largo, smashing him into his own ship with tremendous force.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's combat superiority over the Amigo Pirates and protects Little East Blue from the threat.

events.title: Shiki the Golden Lion Debuts
events.description: Shiki, the legendary pirate known as the Golden Lion, makes his first appearance in the anime through flashbacks of his escape from Impel Down. He demonstrates his Fuwa Fuwa no Mi abilities.
events.significance: Introduces one of the most powerful pirates from the previous generation and the main antagonist of the Strong World movie tie-in.

events.title: Fuwa Fuwa no Mi Power Demonstration
events.description: Shiki demonstrates his Fuwa Fuwa no Mi (Float-Float Fruit) abilities during his escape from Impel Down, using the power to levitate himself and escape into the air after cutting off his shackled legs.
events.significance: Reveals one of the most powerful Paramecia-type Devil Fruits, which allows the user to levitate non-living objects and themselves.

themes.description: Little East Blue serves as a recreation of the Straw Hats' origins in the East Blue, reminding them of where they came from and how far they've traveled.
themes.symbolism: The island represents the crew's roots and the bonds they formed in their home sea.

themes.description: Shiki's willingness to cut off his own legs to escape Impel Down demonstrates the extreme lengths some will go to for freedom.
themes.symbolism: His self-mutilation represents the price of freedom and the determination of legendary pirates.

themes.description: Yoko's hatred of all pirates due to her father's death shows how personal tragedy can lead to prejudice, setting up a conflict between her and the Straw Hats.
themes.symbolism: Her character arc represents the need to judge individuals rather than groups.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows his typical curiosity and combat prowess while encountering Boss and defeating Largo to protect the island.
keyActions: Battles Boss atop the Thousand Sunny
Tries to recruit Boss to the crew

characterSpotlights.development: Shiki is introduced as a legendary pirate from the previous generation who accomplished the impossible by escaping Impel Down.
keyActions: Cuts off his own legs to escape his shackles
Uses Fuwa Fuwa no Mi to levitate away from Impel Down
Establishes himself as the arc's main threat

characterSpotlights.development: Yoko is introduced as a young woman with deep-seated hatred for pirates due to her father's death.
keyActions: Commands Boss to attack the Straw Hat Pirates
Shows disdain for Luffy as a pirate

mangaDifferences.difference: This entire episode is anime-original filler content created to promote One Piece Film: Strong World. The Little East Blue arc does not appear in the manga.
Shiki's escape from Impel Down was originally shown in Chapter 0 (Strong World prequel chapter), not in the main manga storyline.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the debut of the opening song 'Kaze wo Sagashite' which would be used for episodes 426-458.

sources.title: Kaze wo Sagashite - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Episode 426 is unique in that it contains no opening narration, unlike most One Piece episodes.
This episode achieved an 11.9% TV rating in Japan, ranking #2 for its time slot.
Shiki is the first and only prisoner known to have escaped from Impel Down before Luffy's mass breakout in the Impel Down arc.
The Fuwa Fuwa no Mi was originally created for the Strong World movie, but Oda confirmed it is canon to the main story because Shiki himself is a canon character.

sources.title: One Piece SBS Vol. 109: Oda Confirms A Big Secret About The Golden Lion Shiki

trivia.fact: This episode takes place a few days before the events of One Piece Film: Strong World.

sources.title: Little East Blue Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Naoto Takenaka, who voices Shiki in Japanese, is a famous actor and director in Japan who rarely does voice acting work.

sources.title: Shiki Voice - One Piece - Behind The Voice Actors
